campaign.subject: Set up your team for seamless collaboration

slides.title: Team Collaboration

content.headline: Get Your Whole Team Working Together
content.subhead: Set up team access and workflows

slides.narration: As your business grows, you need your team working in the same system—but with the right access levels. Let's set up team collaboration that keeps everyone productive and information secure.

slides.title: What You'll Set Up
slides.narration: We'll add your team members to the system, set up roles and permissions so everyone has appropriate access, configure workflow assignments so tasks go to the right people, and set up communication and notifications.

slides.title: Step 1: Add Team Members
slides.narration: Add team members. Go to Settings, then Team. Click Invite Member. Enter their email and select their role. Admin gets full access including billing. Manager gets most access without billing settings. Staff handles day-to-day tasks. View-only sees reports and dashboards. Send the invitation—they'll get an email to set up their account.

slides.title: Step 2: Configure Permissions

content.principle: Least privilege: Give access needed for their role, not more

slides.narration: Configure permissions for each role. Control access to contacts and customer data, marketing campaigns, reports and analytics, billing and payments, settings and integrations. Follow the principle of least privilege—give people the access they need for their role, not more. You can always expand later.

slides.title: Step 3: Workflow Assignments
slides.narration: Set up workflow assignments so tasks route automatically. New leads go to sales team. Support requests go to service team. Review responses route to assigned staff. Appointments route to specific team members. Use round-robin for equal distribution, load balancing based on current assignments, specialty routing for specific services, and escalation paths when things need management attention.

slides.title: Step 4: Notifications
slides.narration: Set up notifications to keep everyone informed. Task assigned, deadline approaching, customer response received, escalation triggered. Deliver through multiple channels: in-app notifications for when they're working, email for important alerts, mobile push for urgent items, Slack or Teams integration for real-time team awareness.

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Start with fewer permissions, expand as needed
Create permission templates for common roles
Use activity logs to track who did what

slides.narration: Team collaboration pro tips. Start with fewer permissions and expand as needed—easier than restricting later. Create permission templates for common roles so onboarding is consistent. Review access quarterly—remove access for changed roles. Use activity logs to track who did what for accountability.

slides.title: Build Your Team
slides.narration: Ready to get your team working together? Invite your first team member now. Or review role templates to plan your permission structure first. Collaboration makes everyone more effective.
